subject: Philosophy
title: Filial Piety
description: A fast breakdown of Filial Piety for builders.

hook.text: In Confucianism, respecting your parents isn't optional. It's the root of all morality.

buildup.text: Filial piety (xiao) means honoring parents, caring for them in old age, and continuing their legacy.

discovery.text: Confucius believed that if you can't love your parents well, you can't love anyone well.

twist.text: Critics say filial piety can be oppressive â€” silencing children and enforcing blind obedience.

climax.text: Modern Confucians reinterpret it: respect doesn't mean silence. Love can include honest disagreement.

punchline.text: Love begins at home. That's where ethics starts.

quiz.question: What is filial piety in Confucianism?
options: Deep respect and care for one's parents
